Woe<S>1945</S> to the bloody<S>1818</S> city<S>5892</S>! it is all full<S>4392</S> of lies<S>3585</S> and robbery<S>6563</S>; the prey<S>2964</S> departeth<S>4185</S> not; <sup>bloody: Heb. city of bloods</sup>
The noise<S>6963</S> of a whip<S>7752</S>, and the noise<S>6963</S> of the rattling<S>7494</S> of the wheels<S>212</S>, and of the pransing<S>1725</S> horses<S>5483</S>, and of the jumping<S>7540</S> chariots<S>4818</S>.
The horseman<S>6571</S> lifteth up<S>5927</S> both the bright<S>3851</S> sword<S>2719</S> and the glittering<S>1300</S> spear<S>2595</S>: and there is a multitude<S>7230</S> of slain<S>2491</S>, and a great<S>3514</S> number of carcases<S>6297</S>; and there is none end<S>7097</S> of their corpses<S>1472</S>; they stumble<S>3782</S> <S>3782</S> upon their corpses<S>1472</S>: <sup>the bright: Heb. the flame of the sword, and the lightning of the spear</sup>
Because of the multitude<S>7230</S> of the whoredoms<S>2183</S> of the wellfavoured<S>2896</S> <S>2580</S> harlot<S>2181</S>, the mistress<S>1172</S> of witchcrafts<S>3785</S>, that selleth<S>4376</S> nations<S>1471</S> through her whoredoms<S>2183</S>, and families<S>4940</S> through her witchcrafts<S>3785</S>.
Behold, I am against thee, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>; and I will discover<S>1540</S> thy skirts<S>7757</S> upon thy face<S>6440</S>, and I will shew<S>7200</S> the nations<S>1471</S> thy nakedness<S>4626</S>, and the kingdoms<S>4467</S> thy shame<S>7036</S>.
And I will cast<S>7993</S> abominable filth<S>8251</S> upon thee, and make thee vile<S>5034</S>, and will set<S>7760</S> thee as a gazingstock<S>7210</S>.
And it shall come to pass, that all they that look<S>7200</S> upon thee shall flee<S>5074</S> from thee, and say<S>559</S>, Nineveh<S>5210</S> is laid waste<S>7703</S>: who will bemoan<S>5110</S> her? whence<S>370</S> shall I seek<S>1245</S> comforters<S>5162</S> for thee?
Art thou better<S>3190</S> than populous<S>527</S> <S>528</S> No<S>4996</S>, that was situate<S>3427</S> among the rivers<S>2975</S>, that had the waters<S>4325</S> round about<S>5439</S> it, whose rampart<S>2426</S> was the sea<S>3220</S>, and her wall<S>2346</S> was from the sea<S>3220</S>? <sup>populous: or, nourishing, etc: Heb. No Amon</sup>
Ethiopia<S>3568</S> and Egypt<S>4714</S> were her strength<S>6109</S>, and it was infinite<S>369</S> <S>7097</S>; Put<S>6316</S> and Lubim<S>3864</S> were thy helpers<S>5833</S>. <sup>thy helpers: Heb. in thy help</sup>
Yet was she carried away<S>1473</S>, she went<S>1980</S> into captivity<S>7628</S>: her young children<S>5768</S> also were dashed in pieces<S>7376</S> at the top<S>7218</S> of all the streets<S>2351</S>: and they cast<S>3032</S> lots<S>1486</S> for her honourable men<S>3513</S>, and all her great men<S>1419</S> were bound<S>7576</S> in chains<S>2131</S>.
Thou also shalt be drunken<S>7937</S>: thou shalt be hid<S>5956</S>, thou also shalt seek<S>1245</S> strength<S>4581</S> because of the enemy<S>341</S>.
All thy strong holds<S>4013</S> shall be like fig trees<S>8384</S> with the firstripe figs<S>1061</S>: if they be shaken<S>5128</S>, they shall even fall<S>5307</S> into the mouth<S>6310</S> of the eater<S>398</S>.
Behold, thy people<S>5971</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> of thee are women<S>802</S>: the gates<S>8179</S> of thy land<S>776</S> shall be set wide<S>6605</S> open<S>6605</S> unto thine enemies<S>341</S>: the fire<S>784</S> shall devour<S>398</S> thy bars<S>1280</S>.
Draw<S>7579</S> thee waters<S>4325</S> for the siege<S>4692</S>, fortify<S>2388</S> thy strong holds<S>4013</S>: go<S>935</S> into clay<S>2916</S>, and tread<S>7429</S> the morter<S>2563</S>, make strong<S>2388</S> the brickkiln<S>4404</S>.
There shall the fire<S>784</S> devour<S>398</S> thee; the sword<S>2719</S> shall cut thee off<S>3772</S>, it shall eat thee up<S>398</S> like the cankerworm<S>3218</S>: make thyself many<S>3513</S> as the cankerworm<S>3218</S>, make thyself many<S>3513</S> as the locusts<S>697</S>.
Thou hast multiplied<S>7235</S> thy merchants<S>7402</S> above the stars<S>3556</S> of heaven<S>8064</S>: the cankerworm<S>3218</S> spoileth<S>6584</S>, and flieth away<S>5774</S>. <sup>spoileth: or, spreadeth himself</sup>
Thy crowned<S>4502</S> are as the locusts<S>697</S>, and thy captains<S>2951</S> as the great grasshoppers<S>1462</S>, which camp<S>2583</S> in the hedges<S>1448</S> in the cold<S>7135</S> day<S>3117</S>, but when the sun<S>8121</S> ariseth<S>2224</S> they flee away<S>5074</S>, and their place<S>4725</S> is not known<S>3045</S> where<S>335</S> they are.
Thy shepherds<S>7462</S> slumber<S>5123</S>, O king<S>4428</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>: thy nobles<S>117</S> shall dwell<S>7931</S> in the dust: thy people<S>5971</S> is scattered<S>6335</S> upon the mountains<S>2022</S>, and no man gathereth<S>6908</S> them. <sup>nobles: or, valiant ones</sup>
There is no healing<S>3545</S> of thy bruise<S>7667</S>; thy wound<S>4347</S> is grievous<S>2470</S>: all that hear<S>8085</S> the bruit<S>8088</S> of thee shall clap<S>8628</S> the hands<S>3709</S> over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness<S>7451</S> passed<S>5674</S> continually<S>8548</S>? <sup>healing: Heb. wrinkling</sup>
